hero.title: Liver Cirrhosis
hero.description:
Liver Cirrhosis is a progressive condition where healthy liver tissue is replaced with scar tissue, leading to reduced liver function.

This scarring prevents the liver from functioning properly — affecting digestion, detoxification, and overall health.

data.lable: Why Understanding the Cause is Important
data.description:
Cirrhosis usually develops slowly over time, and in many cases, early intervention can help slow progression and improve liver function.

The liver is one of the few organs in the body capable of regeneration — and this is where regenerative medicine plays a role.

data.title: What actually happens in Liver Cirrhosis?
data.contentHTML:
• Ongoing damage causes inflammation in liver cells
  • The body repairs this damage by forming scar tissue
  • Over time, scar tissue replaces healthy liver cells
  • Blood flow through the liver becomes restricted
  • Liver functions start to decline
data.messageHTML: Cirrhosis does not happen overnight. Many patients remain unaware until symptoms become noticeable.

data.title: Common causes of Liver Cirrhosis
data.contentHTML:
• Long-term alcohol consumption
  • Fatty liver disease (related to lifestyle or metabolism)
  • Chronic viral infections (Hepatitis B or C)
  • Long-standing liver inflammation
  • Certain genetic or autoimmune conditions
data.messageHTML: Different causes may require different treatment strategies.

data.title: How is Liver Cirrhosis usually managed?
data.contentHTML:
Traditional medical care focuses on:

  • Managing symptoms
  • Slowing disease progression
  • Preventing complications
  • In severe cases, liver transplantation
data.messageHTML:
Limitations:

Conventional treatments often do not restore damaged liver tissue — they mainly prevent further damage.

faqs.question: What exactly is an autoimmune disease?
faqs.answer: An autoimmune disease happens when the immune system, which normally protects you from infections, mistakenly attacks your own body. This can cause ongoing inflammation and symptoms that come and go over time.
